medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain with associated nausea and non-bloody non-bilious emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptom onset occurred at 3AM, with the patient awaking from sleep due to diffuse abdominal pain. The pain was acute, and the patient reported chronic constipation attributed to venlafaxine, unchanged duration of which was not specified. She continues to pass gas and denies symptoms like fevers, chills, chest pain, shortness of breath, dysuria, or urinary frequency.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. Chronic Hepatitis C in remission following IV treatment. 2. History of cholecystectomy after treatment for hepatitis. 3. Chronic constipation attributed to venlafaxine. 4. Past medical history including actinic keratosis, back pain, palpitations, migraines, incontinence, cold sores, bladder suspension and tubal ligation, seasonal allergies, anxiety, hyperlipidemia, and obesity.
medical_history.social_history: History of alcohol dependence, stable to slightly less, continues on acamprosate.
